source.name: Search Goldman Sachs's 10,000 Women Grants
source.description: Goldman Sachs launched its 10,000 Women initiative with great fanfare in 2008, setting the ambitious goal of spending $100 million over five years to train women entrepreneurs in developing countries. Devex Impact set out to discover where the bank spent the money, how they measured results, and whether the program set a new standard for strategic corporate philanthropy. Read the story and search the grants using the bar on the right. This database was compiled using the Goldman Sachs Foundation's tax returns from 2008-2011. The listed grants don't reflect all organizations that benefited from the program, nor do their grant amounts reflect the total amount an organization received, as some grantee institutions hired subcontractors. The "country served" column was derived from the grant descriptions on the foundation's tax return. In some cases, more than one country was listed and in other cases it was impossible to determine based on the grant description.
